# InvestorRelations

Loading ...

  * [Corporate Website](https://about.groupon.com/)
  * [Customer Support](https://www.groupon.com/customer_support)



## Groupon is a place where customers can discover new experiences every day and local businesses thrive.

Strong partnerships with great local businesses are at the very heart of Groupon. These partnerships allow us to bring the best experiences and value to our customers, whether they’re looking for new things to try, taste, learn or do. And, by connecting our customers with our merchant partners, we create relationships between loyal, repeat customers and quality local businesses that help communities thrive.

## Groupon is a Leading Local Marketplace

### One Million+ Merchants

Worked with to Date

### More than $25 Billion

Pumped into Local Businesses

### More than$35 Billion Saved

By Consumers in North America

Founded in

### 2008

Headquartered in

### Chicago

### Beloved

global brand

### Mobile First

>75% of Transactions on Mobile

### Leader

in the fragmented $1T Local market

### Over 1.5 Billion Groupons

Sold Globally

[Download the latest fact sheet ›](https://about.groupon.com/press/by-the-numbers/)

## Latest Quarterly Results

Loading slideshow...

Loading latest financials...

[All Quarters ›](https://investor.groupon.com/financials/quarterly-results/default.aspx)

## Groupon in the Community

###  At Groupon, we help communities thrive through a portfolio of initiatives that include employee volunteerism, local community development, strategic investment in nonprofit partnerships, cause marketing, and responsible business practices. 

Our goal is to empower our employees and customers to take part in making the communities in which we operate better places to work and live.​ Groupon is the place you start when you want to buy just about anything, anytime, anywhere. But even more — we also want it to be the company you think of when it comes to helping build communities where individuals and families can thrive and prosper. 

[Social Responsibility ›](https://about.groupon.com/social-responsibility/)

[Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion ›](https://about.groupon.com/diversity-equity-and-inclusion/)

[Our People ›](https://about.groupon.com/our-people/)

## Built with Groupon

###  Groupon champions small businesses by connecting customers and merchants with their communities through effective local business marketing campaigns. 

In this video, Marisol Sarabia and Ziba Lennox of MaZi Dance Fitness share how Groupon helps them pull people out of their comfort zones and stay relevant in a changing marketing landscape. 

MaZi Dance Fitness was co-founded in 2009 by two sisters who, upon retiring from professional ballet and entering the corporate world, found that they missed the physical, emotional, and social fulfillment they drew from dance studios. MaZi offers a fun and engaging alternative for people not motivated by regular workout routines, and uses Groupon campaigns to get people hooked on their nontraditional model. 

## Latest News

##  Investor Email Alerts

To opt-in for investor email alerts, please enter your email address in the field below and select at least one alert option. After submitting your request, you will receive an activation email to the requested email address. You must click the activation link in order to complete your subscription. You can sign up for additional alert options at any time.

At Groupon, we promise to treat your data with respect and will not share your information with any third party. You can unsubscribe to any of the investor alerts you are subscribed to by visiting the ‘unsubscribe’ section below. If you experience any issues with this process, please contact us for further assistance.

**By providing your email address below, you are providing consent to Groupon to send you the requested Investor Email Alert updates.**

* Required

## Forward-looking Statements

The statements contained in this presentation that refer to plans and expectations for the next quarter, the full year or the future are forward-looking statements within the meaning of Section 27A of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, and Section 21E of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, including statements regarding our future results of operations and financial position, business strategy and plans and our objectives for future operations. The words "may," "will," "should," "could," "expect," "anticipate," "believe,“ "estimate," "intend," "continue" and other similar expressions are intended to identify forward-looking statements. We have based these forward-looking statements largely on current expectations and projections about future events and financial trends that we believe may affect our financial condition, results of operations, business strategy, short-term and long-term business operations and objectives, and financial needs. These forward-looking statements involve risks and uncertainties that could cause our actual results to differ materially from those expressed or implied in our forward-looking statements. Such risks and uncertainties include, but are not limited to, our ability to execute, and achieve the expected benefits of our go-forward strategy, including our planned exit from the Goods business; volatility in our operating results; execution of our business and marketing strategies; retaining existing customers and adding new customers; challenges arising from our international operations, including fluctuations in currency exchange rates, legal and regulatory developments and any potential adverse impact from the United Kingdom\'s exit from the European Union, retaining and adding high quality merchants; our reliance on email, internet search engines and mobile application marketplaces to drive traffic to our marketplace; cybersecurity breaches; reliance on cloud-based computing platforms; competing successfully in our industry; providing a strong mobile experience for our customers; maintaining and improving our information technology infrastructure; our voucherless offerings; claims related to product and service offerings; managing inventory and order fulfillment risks; litigation; managing refund risks; retaining and attracting members of our executive team; completing and realizing the anticipated benefits from acquisitions, dispositions, joint ventures and strategic investments; lack of control over minority investments; compliance with domestic and foreign laws and regulations, including the CARD Act, GDPR and regulation of the Internet and e-commerce; classification of our independent contractors or employees; tax liabilities; tax legislation; protecting our intellectual property; maintaining a strong brand; customer and merchant fraud; payment-related risks; our ability to raise capital if necessary and our outstanding indebtedness; global economic uncertainty; our common stock, including volatility in our stock price; our convertible senior notes; and our and our ability to realize the anticipated benefits from the hedge and warrant transactions. For additional information regarding these and other risks and uncertainties, we urge you to refer to the factors included under the headings "Risk Factors" and "Management\'s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations" in our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2019 and our other filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission, copies of which may be obtained by visiting our Investor Relations website at [http://investor.groupon.com](http://investor.groupon.com/) or the SEC\'s web site at [www.sec.gov](http://www.sec.gov/). Groupon\'s actual results could differ materially from those predicted or implied and reported results should not be considered an indication of future performance.You should not rely upon forward-looking statements as predictions of future events. Although Groupon believes that the expectations reflected in the forward-looking statements are reasonable, it cannot guarantee that the future results, levels of activity, performance or events and circumstances reflected in the forward-looking statements will be achieved or occur. Moreover, neither our nor any other person assumes responsibility for the accuracy and completeness of the forward-looking statements. The forward-looking statements reflect Groupon’s expectations the date of this presentation unless otherwise expressly stated. Groupon undertakes no obligation to update publicly any forward-looking statements for any reason after the date of this presentation to conform these statements to actual results or to changes in its expectations.Additional information relating to certain of our financial measures contained herein, including non-GAAP financial measures, is available in our most recent earnings release and at our website at [investor.groupon.com](http://investor.groupon.com/).

# Press

[About](https://www.groupon.com/articles/about/)[Team](https://www.groupon.com/articles/team/)[DEI](https://www.groupon.com/articles/dei/)[Press](https://press.groupon.com/)[Jobs](https://www.grouponcareers.com/)[Investors](https://investor.groupon.com/)

# Our press team is always happy to share compelling and unique stories about Groupon. If you are a journalist and would like to talk, please get in touch via press@groupon.com

If you are a customer or merchant and have a question, please contact our [Customer Service](https://www.groupon.com/faq) or [Groupon Merchant](https://www.groupon.com/merchant/) teams.

# By The Numbers

# $436M

Billings

# $138M

Revenue

# $122M

Gross Profits

# 16.5M

Active Customers*

# 11M

Units Sold

# $142M

Cash as of 12/31**

*Active Customers are defined as unique user accounts that have made a purchase during the trailing twelve months ("TTM") either through one of our online marketplaces or directly with a merchant for which we earned a commission.**Includes $43M of outstanding borrowings under our revolving credit facility.

[Download the Latest Fact Sheet](https://img.grouponcdn.com/seocms/498Hdg2pyWzBgwTU5xFovHqbwPZn/2023_Q4_Factsheet_jpg-1344x2304)

# Press Releases

Find all of our press releases on the news page:

[Read the News](https://www.groupon.com/articles/news)

![](https://img.grouponcdn.com/seocms/EGrS8VsWPd7dhrVwqVScWrQ1kpw/gif-investor-white_gif-200x204)

# Should I Invest in Groupon?

Read the most recent quarterly financial reports, earnings press releases and other business updates on our dedicated Investor Relations page.

[Learn About Investing](https://investor.groupon.com/)

# Brand Assets

As a strategic partner of Groupon, you may be permitted to use the Groupon Brand Assets presented here, provided usage is approved pursuant to the terms of your partnership agreement with Groupon and also that you follow the guidelines carefully laidout within this presentation.

In addition, if you intend to use the Groupon Brand Assets, you must request written permission by contacting brand@groupon.com.

[Brand Guidelines](https://www.dropbox.com/sh/88518ph8v06efmh/AABHEK_8qcpwmUcLJF5MDOi2a?dl=1) [Logos](https://www.dropbox.com/sh/1rq1i96zeuu5lh8/AACzT8-mqUfWHSIjs6Kl-jOHa?dl=1) [Photography](https://www.dropbox.com/sh/4y8odjoylqf7s12/AADiYVs3SReM-W17CSyxXWXPa?dl=1) [Portrait](https://img.grouponcdn.com/seocms/31QSyjgwXXg8oXN9cTYL64Wyh1En/dusan-portrait_jpg-2560x1698) [Office Footage](https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/suhnvbph3qj4un1wofb2y/Groupon-Office-Footage.mp4?rlkey=gabk9b3eczrm2bdku97rug5xa&dl=1) [App Footage](https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/rpv0flonfcficv8qsyvz1/Groupon-App-Footage.mp4?rlkey=wol24n5w4dh3zdttw0dh1e04b&dl=1) [Site Footage](https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/7jmztj6xwptzo82g69vum/Groupon-Site-Footage.mp4?rlkey=c1x4u6uy4veqk72pwignjxk7y&dl=1)
